text: And Jonah prayed to Yahweh his God from the belly of the fish
and said,
“I called ⸤from my distress⸥\f + \fr 2:2 \ft Literally “from distress for me” \f* to Yahweh,
and he answered me;
from the belly of Sheol\f + \fr 2:2 \ft “Sheol” is a Hebrew term for the place where the dead reside (i.e. the Underworld) \f* I cried for help—
you heard my voice.
And you threw me \add into the\add* deep,
into the heart of \add the\add* seas,
and \add the\add* sea currents surrounded me;
all your breakers and your surging waves
passed over me.
And I said, ‘I am banished\f + \fr 2:4 \ft Or “expelled,” or “driven away” \f*
from your sight;
how\f + \fr 2:4 \ft Or “however, I will continue to look on your holy temple” \f* ⸤will I continue to look⸥\f + \fr 2:4 \ft Literally “will I do again to look,” meaning “will I continue to look” \f*
⸤on your holy temple⸥?’\f + \fr 2:4 \ft Literally “on the temple of your holiness” \f*
\add The\add* waters encompassed me up to \add my\add* neck;
\add the\add* deep surrounded me;
seaweed was wrapped around my head.
I went down to the foundations of \add the\add* mountains;
the Underworld—its bars \add were\add* around me forever.
But you brought up my life from \add the\add* pit,
Yahweh my God.
When my life was ebbing away from me,
I remembered Yahweh,
and my prayer came to you,
⸤to your holy temple⸥.\f + \fr 2:7 \ft Literally “to the temple of your holiness” \f*
Those who worship vain idols

forsake their loyal love.\f + \fr 2:8 \ft This could mean (1) they forsake the loyal love they should show to God or (2) they forfeit \fq forsake \ft the loyal love that God would have shown to them \f*
But I, with a voice of thanksgiving,
will sacrifice to you;
I will fulfill what I have vowed.
Deliverance\f + \fr 2:9 \ft Or “salvation” \f* \add belongs\add* to Yahweh!”
And Yahweh spoke to the fish, and it vomited Jonah out on the dry land.
